event.name: Conexão Mulher: IA sem Mistério
event.full_title: Conexão + Inovação: IA sem Mistério – Aplicações Práticas + Reflexões Humanas

location.address: Praça Marechal Deodoro, 110, Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre, RS, Brasil
location.venue_prestige: Historic government building, former seat of state government (1896-1921)
location.architectural_significance: Listed as state historical heritage by IPHAE in 1982, nicknamed 'Fort Apache'

organizer.primary: Associação do Ministério Público do Rio Grande do Sul (AMP/RS)

structure: Main presentation by Lisiane Lemos (45 minutes)

main_speaker.name: Lisiane Lemos
main_speaker.title: Extraordinary Secretary of Digital Inclusion and Support for Equity Policies of Rio Grande do Sul

background.experience: Technology specialist, former executive at multinational companies including Google and Microsoft
background.education: MBA in Technology for Business professor at PUCRS
background.recognition: Forbes Under 30, UN MIPAD most influential Black women worldwide
background.google_connection: Mentor at Google's Black Founders Fund program
background.initiatives: Co-founder of Instituto Conselheira 101, accelerator for Black and Indigenous women

moderator.name: Julia Schutt
moderator.title: Prosecutor and Member of Innovation and Technology Center at AMP/RS

background.position: Auxiliary Member in the Presidency of National Council of Public Ministry (CNMP)
background.education: Master's and Doctorate in Law from University of Salamanca/USAL, Spain
background.focus: Public Ministry modernization and responsible technology use

key_topics: Practical AI applications in different industries
Breaking barriers for women in tech
Career paths in AI and technology
learning_outcomes: Identifying opportunities for women in AI careers

women_in_ai_mission.role: Promoting female leadership and participation in artificial intelligence
objectives: Increase women's representation in AI fields
Provide role models and mentorship opportunities
Create networking opportunities for women in tech
impact_metrics: Only 20% of AI positions globally are held by women
Need to increase female participation in STEM
Importance of diverse perspectives in AI development
Breaking stereotypes about women in technology

primary: Women in technology and STEM fields
Students interested in AI and technology careers
Legal professionals interested in tech innovation
Public sector workers involved in digital transformation

demographics.gender: Primarily women, but open to all genders
demographics.geographic_focus: Rio Grande do Sul state, broader Brazilian market

attendee_profiles: Legal professionals interested in tech law

government_support: Rio Grande do Sul state government
Public Ministry of Rio Grande do Sul

methods: Restricted area on AMP/RS portal for members
registration.cost: Free for AMP/RS associates and partners

brazilian_context.women_in_tech_stats: Only 20% of AI positions in Brazil held by women
brazilian_context.regional_focus: Rio Grande do Sul as innovation hub
brazilian_context.public_sector_innovation: Government leading by example in tech inclusion

systemic_change_goals: Increase female enrollment in AI/tech programs
Create mentorship networks for women in tech
Influence corporate hiring and promotion practices
Develop public policies supporting women in tech

medium_term: Increased female applications to tech programs
long_term: Higher representation of women in AI in RS
Policy changes supporting women in tech
Role model effect inspiring next generation
Sustainable community of women in AI

key_messages: AI is accessible to everyone, not just technical experts
Women's perspectives are crucial for ethical AI development
Public sector leadership in promoting tech diversity
Rio Grande do Sul as innovation and inclusion leader

success_metrics.engagement: Active participation in Q&A and networking
success_metrics.follow_up: 50%+ of attendees engage in follow-up activities
success_metrics.career_impact: Track career progressions of attendees over 12 months
success_metrics.media_reach: Coverage in at least 5 major outlets
success_metrics.policy_influence: Integration into state digital inclusion policies

accessibility.linguistic: Portuguese primary, translation available if needed
accessibility.economic: Free registration to ensure financial accessibility
accessibility.technological: Live streaming option for remote participation
